title: How to write a thesis statement for an argumentative essay - Quora

response.answer_text: What is your opinion about the topic? What reasons do you have for your opinion? What support do you have for your reasons? Your thesis is your opinion based on reasons and support.  For an assignment, you have to limit your topic so that you can fill up the word count with enough information in detail, but not skim over the topic.  Thesis can't be a question, but could be the answer to a question. Thesis can't be a fact, as there is no opinion to a fact: it is true or false. Thesis has only one idea to defend.  Topic: High School Uniforms Requiring uniforms can create a better learning environment by reducing contrasts between different social groups, changing teacher perception of students,  and making outsiders easier to spot.  Requiring uniforms in high school creates a burden on lower income parents, restricts personal expression, and masks the conflicts between social groups.

An argumentative essay is one of those tricky essays where you must keep a lot of points in check. In an argumentative essay you pick a topic and then take a stand on your opinion about it. Therefore the thesis statement you write should clearly reflect on the main topic of the essay, the argument which is up for debate and your opinion on it. In an argumentative essay you are expected to present your opinions on the topic, with supporting evidence. What you should do in the essay statement of an argumentative essay: Present the main topic Mention the main argument you are opposing or defendingA glimpse at your reason for supporting or opposing the thesisWhat you shouldn’t do in the Thesis statement of an argumentative essay:You shouldn’t put a question in a thesis statementDo not put evidence or facts in the thesis statementYou should provide only one argument to defend on supportExample of a good, thesis statement: The process of retrieval practice is the process of learning through recollecting knowledge from memory which can do more harm than good in the competitive classroom environment.
